PageTitle: peer filter-policy export (BGP view/BGP-IPv4 unicast address family view)(IPv4)
FuncDef:
The peer filter-policy export command configures an ACL-based policy for filtering BGP routes to be advertised to a specified peer.
The undo peer filter-policy export command cancels this configuration. The peer filter-policy export command configures an ACL-based policy for filtering BGP routes to be advertised to a specified peer. The undo peer filter-policy export command cancels this configuration. By default, no filtering policy is configured for the routes to be advertised to peers.
ParentView: BGP-IPv4 unicast address family view,BGP view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv4 address of a peer.
The value is in the dotted decimal format.

Specifies the number of the basic ACL.
The value is an integer ranging from 2000 to 2999.

Specifies the name of a named basic ACL.
The value is a string of 1 to 64 case-sensitive characters starting with a letter. It cannot contain spaces.

ExtraInfo: If you do not want all routes to be advertised to a peer, you can run the peer filter-policy export command to configure an ACL-based filtering policy to filter the routes to be advertised to the peer.
